The robbery was planned by John Clay and an accomplice, who created an elaborate scheme to distract a pawnbroker. Holmes deduces that the 'Red-headed League' and the job the pawnbroker was given were all ruses to enable the criminals to spend hours every day in the cellar. He believed the assistant was attempting to run a tunnel to another building hence his constant presence in the cellar.
